intro: Morolobium, commonly known as the moonflower vine, is a striking plant characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to tropical regions of the Americas. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, fragrant blooms that open in the evening. Morolobium thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its unique flowering pattern makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
